Bush did not always receive, and may not have insisted on, a timely consideration of his options before he made a decision, nor did he always receive effective implementation of the decisions he made, Donald Rumsfeld wrote. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the Iraq war, he wrote:`` In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped.''

confirmed that it would be proper for the attorney general to obtain the views of ministers on the national interest before reaching his own independent decision. Ministers' views would be passed to the DPP and he would then exercise independent judgment, taking on board the serious considerations that have been given to the matter by other ministers and the attorney general . All this strikes me as perfectly proper. Tom Watson, the former defence minister who used his seat on the culture select committee to chase down Andy Coulson , said his departure creates serious questions over the prime minister's judgment and points to the need for a deeper investigation into the affairs of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp . He called on Rupert Murdoch to clean up his operation before pursuing his Â£ 8.3 bn complete takeover of BSkyB. Rupert Murdoch is waiting to hear if his bid will be referred to the Competition Commission.
